title: Remove references to master and slave and other oppressive terms in the codebase
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In accordance with https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-knodel-terminology-00.html , remove oppressive language from the codebase.  Specifically the words slave and master which appear in code, comments and documentation.  They can be replaced with primary / secondary or in the case of Spark, primary / {worker / executor}.  

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**
Search the codebase for master, slave and make sure they do not appear.  The words whitelist and blacklist have been removed from the codebase already.  

**Expected behavior**
The code will continue to work as before.  

**Environment details (please complete the following information)**
N/A

**Additional context**
The words whitelist and blacklist have already been removed.  

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Search the codebase and documentation for master, slave and make sure they do not appear.  

**Additional context**
https://developers.google.com/style/inclusive-documentation

Changes in Spark: 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-32004 Drop references to slave
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-32036 Remove references to "blacklist"/"whitelist" language (outside of blacklisting feature)
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-32037 Rename blacklisting feature to avoid language with racist connotation
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-32333 Drop references to Master
